entry.title: Hillary Clinton's slide bolsters interest in run by Joe Biden
Hillary Clinton faces fresh worries in Congress over emails
entry.summary:
Hillary Rodham Clinton is facing fresh worries among congressional Democrats about her use of a private email account while serving as secretary of state, as new polls signal that the inquiry is taking a toll on her presidential campaign.

"Look, we fully expect that Republicans are going to continue to want to talk about Hillary Clinton's emails," Fallon says at the end of the video.

entry.title: New Jersey woman's obituary says in lieu of flowers, please don't vote for Hillary Clinton
entry.summary: RUNNEMEDE, N.J. - A New Jersey woman has used her obituary to make a final request to friends and family: Please don't vote for Hillary Rodham Clinton for president.

entry.summary: WASHINGTON -- Now that federal investigators have Hillary Rodham Clinton's homebrew e-mail server, they could examine files on her machine that would be more revelatory than the e-mails themselves.

Hillary Clinton to give private email server to U.S. Justice Department
entry.summary:
U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton listens to a question from the audience during a community forum about substance abuse in Keene, New Hampshire August 11, 2015.

Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton is giving the U.S. Justice Department her private email server and a thumb drive of work-related emails from her tenure as secretary of state, a spokesman for her campaign said on Tuesday.

entry.title: Clinton to hand over email server
Hillary Clinton to hand over private email server
entry.summary: Clinton handed over about 30,000 emails she sent and received, although her staff have since acknowledged without explanation that some work emails are missing.

entry.title: Clinton relents, gives up possession of private email server
entry.summary: "All this means is that Hillary Clinton, in the face of FBI scrutiny, has decided she has run out of options," Republican National Committee Chairman Reince Priebus said in a statement.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton relents, gives private email server to Justice Department
entry.summary: WASHINGTON -- Hillary Rodham Clinton relented Tuesday to months of demands she relinquish the personal email server she used while secretary of state, directing the device be given to the Justice Department.

entry.title: US official: FBI has Hillary Clinton emails from home server
entry.summary: WASHINGTON (AP) - The FBI has taken possession of thumb drives containing Hillary Clinton's emails, some of which have been deemed to contain highly sensitive classified information, according to a U.S. official briefed on the matter.

entry.title: Clinton thought Trump wedding would be "entertaining"
entry.summary: WASHINGTON (AP) - Hillary Rodham Clinton says she didn't know Donald Trump very well when she attended his 2005 wedding but thought the event would be "fun" and "entertaining."

entry.summary: Hillary Rodham Clinton told a cheering crowd at her largest rally so far that "the endless flow of secret, unaccountable money" must be stopped.

entry.title: Clinton to propose $350 billion college affordability plan
entry.summary: Calling for a "new college compact," Hillary Rodham Clinton on Monday, Aug. 10, will unveil a $350 billion plan aimed at making college more affordable and reducing the crushing burden of student debt.

entry.title: Clinton to unveil costly, detailed plan to tackle student debt
entry.summary: With student debt topping $1.2 trillion and schools raising tuition to make up for cuts in state aid, Clinton's proposal does not go as far as the progressive wing of her party has called for.

FBI looking into the security of Hillary Clinton’s private email setup
entry.summary:
Nick Merrill, a spokesman for Clinton's campaign, declined to comment on the FBI's actions.

He noted that Clinton has called repeatedly for the State Department to release her emails to the public, a process that is ongoing.

Instead, a server that had been purchased for use by Hillary Clinton's 2008 campaign was installed at the Chappaqua home.

entry.title: FBI investigating security of Hillary Clinton's emails
Hillary Clinton slams Bush on immigration, women's health
entry.summary: Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton speaks to supporters during a campaign rally at La Rumba, a Denver dance club and restaurant, Tuesday, Aug. 4, 2015.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton slams Bush on immigration, women's health
entry.summary:
DENVER (AP) - Hillary Clinton on Tuesday repeatedly slammed Jeb Bush and the rest of the Republican presidential field over immigration and women's health during a campaign stop in Denver.

Clinton also criticized Bush for questioning the amount the federal government spends on women's health during a forum earlier Tuesday.

entry.title: Meet Hillary Clinton — Again
entry.summary: "We're going to make sure everyone knows who Hillary Clinton really is - who she fights for and what has motivated her lifelong commitment to children and families," Mook said.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton told David Cameron was 'unsure and inexperienced'
entry.summary: A key confidant of US presidential candidate Hillary Clinton told her David Cameron was "unsure, inexperienced, oblique and largely uncommitted" on foreign policy, it has been revealed.

entry.title: Amid latest release of emails, Hillary Clinton's campaign makes public tax and medical details
entry.summary:
The couple made nearly $23 million from speaking fees alone in 2013 - the year Clinton left the State Department - and collected an additional $20 million from paid events last year.

The remainder of their income came largely from book royalties and consulting fees paid to Bill Clinton.

entry.title: Clinton charity donors surge amid Hillary Clinton's campaign
entry.summary: In May, Hillary Clinton disclosed that she and her husband made more than $25 million from speeches over the past year and a half.

entry.title: Clinton charity donors surge amid Hillary Clinton's campaign
entry.summary:
A new list of donors to the Bill, Hillary and Chelsea Clinton Foundation shows a marked surge in donations and the numbers of contributors to the family charity in the first half of this year - at the same time that Hillary Rodham Clinton ramped up her campaign for the presidency.

"We know that donors are giving more because they are seeing the impact of our work across the globe," said the foundation's new president, Donna Shalala, who was accompanying Bill and Hillary Clinton's daughter, Chelsea, on a tour of foundation programs in Haiti.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton won't take a position on Keystone pipeline
entry.summary: NASHUA, N.H. (AP) - Hillary Clinton says she will not take a position on the Keystone XL pipeline until she becomes president, citing her work on the issue as secretary of state.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton sets renewable energy goals to spur more wind, solar power
entry.summary: Clinton, the front-runner for her party's 2016 presidential nomination, also pledged to have more than half a billion solar panels installed nationwide within four years of taking office.

Democratic presidential hopeful Hillary Rodham Clinton speaks Friday, July 24, 2015, at the New York University Leonard N. Stern School of Business in New York.

Hillary Clinton says she will testify this October before a public hearing of the House committee investigating the deaths of four Americans in Benghazi, Libya.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton agrees to testify before Benghazi committee
entry.summary: Hillary Clinton has agreed to appear before a congressional committee investigating the 2012 attacks that killed the US ambassador to Libya and three other Americans in Benghazi, according to her presidential campaign.

Sources: Justice asked to consider probing Clinton emails
entry.summary: WASHINGTON (AP) - Federal officials say two government inspectors general have asked the Justice Department to determine whether sensitive government information was transmitted on Hillary Rodham Clinton's personal email.

entry.title: Criminal probe sought into Hillary Clinton's email
Report: Criminal inquiry requested over Clinton's email
entry.summary: New probe over Clinton email?

entry.title: U.S. Justice Dept asked to probe Hillary Clinton's email use: Report
entry.summary:
NEW YORK - The U.S. Justice Department is weighing a request by two government inspectors general to open a criminal investigation into Hillary Clinton's use of a private email account for her work as secretary of state, the New York Times reported on Thursday.

Clinton has repeatedly said she broke no laws or rules by eschewing a standard government email account for her State Department work in favor of a private account linked to a computer server in her New York home.
